trans-unit.source: Provides text writer functionality for devices targeted by the XHTML adapter set, including Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML), XHTML Mobile, and Wireless Markup Language (WML).
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
XHTML is an XML-compliant markup that is based on HTML 4.1 and allows you to create Web sites suitable for multiple device types.
It merges HTML's ease of use with XML's strict element guidelines to produce a markup language with a wide range of format and style options and reduced markup tag ambiguity.
This class provides formatting capabilities that ASP.NET server controls use when rendering XHTML content to clients.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> renders markup that meets the standards of three different XHTML doc types: XHTML Basic, which supports limited style and format elements; XHTML Mobile Profile, which supports inline style sheets; and WML 2.0, which is based on XHTML 1.1 and supports cascading style sheets.
This class is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> class can render all HTML elements, attributes, and style attributes, but, unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class, does not allow title capitalization of these markup elements.

An <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> instantiates an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> and depending on the capabilities of the target device, initializes a number of properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SupportsNoWrapStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.UseDivsForBreaks%2A>, that assist the text writer in rendering the page and its controls.
Your adapter can use a variety of methods to apply styles and control formatting:
<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A>,
<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A>, and
<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterFormat%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitFormat%2A>.

This class derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class, which in turn derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter> class, and much of its functionality is provided by these base classes.

You can use the members of this class, and any members it inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class, to create custom text writers to use in a custom XHTML page or in class adapters.
You can also create new derived classes that override the standard behavior of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> class.
Device filtering is required in order to use a specific adapter or text writer for a server control.

For more information about device filtering, see [Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ff05ae9-4109-4352-929e-ad893895dbff) and [Device Filtering Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bdfeaa58-dedd-4c0d-8610-988aac0eff19).
Initializes a new instance of the class for the provided device, using the writer parameter as the base writer object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Text writers are instantiated by a corresponding page adapter for a specific target device, and then used by the page adapter and the adapters for each control on the page.
This class is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The base writer object, usually an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
An object of <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> class that provides the capability information for the target device.
Adds a provided variable name to a list of variables to be embedded in pages for WML devices.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Certain WML devices require a `<wml:onevent>` element to provide information for postback.
WML devices provide limited functionality for navigation and postback, and require WML commands and variables to be written to the page.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The name of a variable to be embedded in a page.
Adds a provided variable name and value to a list of variables to be embedded in pages for WML devices.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Certain WML 2.0 devices require a WML `<wml:onevent>` element to provide information for postback.
WML devices provide limited functionality for navigation and postback, and require WML commands and variables to be written to the page.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The name of the variable.
The value for the variable.

Instructs the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> object to save all rendered markup until written out in its entirety by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.EndCachedRendering"></xref> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Gets the unique key used to retrieve items from the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Cache"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Some devices do not allow inline styles in elements, but require style information to be provided from a linked style sheet.

If the linked style sheet is stored in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache>, the URL contains a unique <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.CacheKey%2A> that identifies the style sheet to return.
For these target devices, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> moves style information from rendered controls to a style sheet for caching.

A page adapter can instruct the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> to save the style sheet in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey%2A>, or in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey%2A> before rendering the page.
This property is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A `string` containing a unique key.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey(System.Web.Caching.Cache)"></xref> method has not been called.
Removes a break that was to be rendered after writing the current element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Gets and sets custom style settings for the body of the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A `string` containing style-sheet information if the property has been set; otherwise, `null`.
Writes out the cached markup and instructs the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> not to save rendered markup.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.

Sets the provided style as the current formatting style if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering"></xref> method has been called.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering%2A> has been called, the `style` is set as the current style, and a beginning `<span>` element that implements the style is written to the output stream.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object containing formatting information.
Sets the provided style as the current layout style if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering"></xref> method has been called.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering%2A> has been called, the `style` is set as the current style, and a beginning `<span>` element that implements the style is written to the output stream.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object containing formatting information.
Sets the provided style as the current style if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering"></xref> method has been called.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering%2A> has been called, `style` is set as the current style, and a beginning `<span>` element that implements the style is written to the output stream.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object containing formatting information.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current formatting style, and calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)"></xref> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object to exit from.
A `Boolean` value that indicates whether to force a break after the current element if the element is not a block element.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current formatting style, and calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)"></xref> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> to exit from.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)"></xref> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object containing the formatting to exit from.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)"></xref> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object containing the layout to exit from.
A `Boolean` value that indicates whether to force a break after the current element if the element is not a block element.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current style, and calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)"></xref> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
Returns a value indicating whether a style has been set.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if a style has been set; otherwise, `false`.
Marks the location in the output stream to insert the `<wml:onevent>` element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called by the page adapter during rendering.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Gets the key used to retrieve items from the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Session"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Some devices do not allow inline styles in elements, but require style information to be provided from a linked style sheet.

If the linked style sheet is stored in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A>, the URL contains a unique <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SessionKey%2A> that identifies the style sheet to return.

For these target devices, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> moves style information from rendered controls to a style sheet for caching in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A>.

A page adapter can instruct the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter> to save the style sheet in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey%2A>, or in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetCacheKey%2A> before rendering the page.
This property is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A `string` containing the key.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SetSessionKey(System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState)"></xref> method has not been called.
Sets the provided style as the style for the `<body>` element of the page and as the default style for its child controls.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
Creates a unique `string` to use when retrieving the style sheet from the cache.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The current <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref> object.

Sets a line break to be rendered after rendering the current element, if it is not a block element and if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> property is `false`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Creates a unique string for a client to use to retrieve a style sheet from the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Session"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Session"></xref> object.
Indicates whether the target device supports the "white-space: nowrap;" style-sheet attribute.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property must be initialized by the page adapter, and is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
`true` if the device supports the "white-space: nowrap;" style-sheet attribute; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteLine"></xref> method should write a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property must be initialized by the page adapter, and is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
`true` to suppress the line terminator string, or `false` to write the line terminator string to the output.

Indicates whether to use `
` tags for line breaks rather than `
` tags when writing line terminators.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property must be initialized by the page adapter, and is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
`false` if the device does not require using `<div>` tags for line breaks; otherwise, `true`.
Writes an attribute and its value to the current element using the provided attribute and value, and encodes the value if specified.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If the value is `null` or an empty string, no attribute is written because XHTML requires that all attributes have values.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The name of the attribute.
The value for the attribute.
If `true`, the value is encoded before being written.
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If there is a pending break, is `false`, and the provided tag is not a block element (such as `

`, `

`, `
    `, or ``), which automatically break before and after the element, the method is called before writing the beginning tag.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The markup element to write to the output stream.
If <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a markup element that adds a new line to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Depending on the value of , the new line markup could be either a `
` tag or a `
` structure.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Writes out all markup cached since calling the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginCachedRendering"></xref> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Writes a `<!DOCTYPE>` declaration that is unique to target devices represented by the provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype"></xref> value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page adapter calls this method, and depending on the `type`, writes the following document type declarations:
Type
Description
\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML Basic 1.0//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-basic/xhtml-basic10.dtd">
\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//WAPFORUM//DTD XHTML Mobile 1.0//EN" "http://www.wapforum.org/DTD/xhtml-mobile10.dtd">
\<\!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//WAPFORUM//DTD WML 2.0//EN" "http://www.wapforum.org/dtd/wml20.dtd">
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype"></xref> value indicating the type of declaration to write.
Encodes and writes the provided value to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The attribute value to encode and write.
Writes any tab spacing and the closing tag of the specified markup element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If the tag is not a block element, such as `

`, `

`, ``, `
    `, the method is called before writing the beginning tag.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The markup element to close.
Writes any tab spacing and the full opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If the tag is not a block element, such as `

`, `

`, ``, `
    `, the method is called before writing the beginning tag.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The markup element to write to the output stream.
Writes the markup for a hidden field to the output stream using the provided name.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteHiddenField%2A> method is useful for pages where client-side code will add and modify the value of this field for postback, because no initial value is provided.
This method is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
The name of the hidden field.
Writes the markup for a hidden field to the output stream using the provided name and value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the hidden field.
The value of the hidden field.

Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string that contains the text representation of two objects, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string containing zero or more format items.
The object to write to the output stream in place of the first format placeholder.
The object to write to the output stream in place of the second format placeholder.

Writes any pending tab spacing and a subarray of Unicode characters, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An array containing the character data to write to the output stream.
The location in the array to start the output.
The number of characters to write to the output stream.

Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string that contains the text representation of an object array, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string containing zero or more format items.
An array containing zero or more objects to format.

Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string containing the text representation of an object, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string containing zero or more format items.
The object to format.

Writes any pending tab spacing and a text string, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The string to write to the output stream.

Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a single-precision floating-point number, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.

The floating-point number to write to the output stream.

Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of an object, and if <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine"></xref> is `false`, writes a line terminator string to the output stream.

Writes an encoded URL, which includes a query-string parameter, to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Both the name of the parameter and the URL value are encoded, and an equal sign (=) is inserted between them.
Spaces in the `name` or `value` strings are encoded as plus signs (+), and equal signs (=) are encoded as %3d.
A string containing the name of the URL parameter.
A string containing the value of the URL parameter.
